shortdesc.ph: Selects the audio tracks for local playback and remote transmission.
Selects the audio tracks for local playback and remote transmission.
Selects the audio tracks for local playback and remote publishing.
Selects the audio tracks for local playback and remote sending.

p.codeblock: Future<void> selectMultiAudioTrack( {required int playoutTrackIndex, required int publishTrackIndex});
public abstract int SelectMultiAudioTrack(int playoutTrackIndex, int publishTrackIndex);

section.p: You can call this method to separately set the audio tracks for local playback and remote transmission. Before calling this method, you need to open the media file using and set enableMultiAudioTrack to via .

You can call this method to separately set the audio tracks for local playback and remote transmission. Before calling this method, you must open the media file using and set enableMultiAudioTrack to via .

You can call this method to separately set the audio tracks for local playback and for publishing to the remote end. Before calling this method, you must open the media file using and set enableMultiAudioTrack to via .

You can call this method to separately set the audio tracks for local playback and for sending to the remote end. Before calling this method, you need to open the media file using and set enableMultiAudioTrack to via .

section.title: Scenario
section.p: In karaoke scenarios, the host can choose to play one track locally (e.g., instrumental) and send another track (e.g., vocals) to the remote audience to enhance their experience.

plentry.pd: The index of the audio track used for local playback. You can get the index via .
The index of the audio track used for remote transmission. You can get the index via .
The index of the audio track for local playback. You can obtain the index value using .
The index of the audio track to send to the remote end. You can obtain the index value using .
The index of the audio track used for local playback. You can get the index via .
The index of the audio track used for publishing to the remote end. You can get the index via .
The index of the audio track used for local playback. You can get the index via .
The index of the audio track sent to the remote end. You can get the index via .

section.title: Return Values
section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly.
< 0: Failure.
